summary: Whitesnake is an English rock band formed in 1978 by singer David Coverdale. They started as a backing band but became their own group, with Coverdale as the only constant member. Their early albums, like "Trouble" and "Lovehunter," were popular in the UK and Europe. In the 1980s, they gained international fame with albums like "Whitesnake," which had hit songs like "Here I Go Again." The band's sound changed from blues rock to a more popular hard rock style. After a break, they reunited in 2003 and have been touring and releasing new music since.
title: Whitesnake
